title: Peaceful Island Getaways: Escaping Urban Chaos
content:
Wumin Island: picturesque rural scenery

When exploring island resorts in Singapore, Ubin Island is a must visit destination. It is easy to reach Wumin Island by ferry from the mainland, which is a peaceful island where time can relax. It is renowned for its ancient rural charm and leisurely atmosphere. Cyclists, hikers, and nature enthusiasts all love this place. Rent a bicycle and ride it around the island, passing through abandoned rubber plantations and lush green spaces along the way

Climb Mount Jegavi to enjoy the magnificent scenery, or kayak through the mangrove forest. Oh, don't forget to go to the Zhegawa Wetland and see the rich and colorful flora and fauna on the island. You can also visit ancient fishing platforms and the remains of brick factories from the past to learn about Singapore's history.

Handu Island: The Natural Charm of Singapore Island Resort

Don't be fooled by this scary name - Hantu Island, also known as "Ghost Island", is deeply loved by nature enthusiasts. These two small islands, Hantu Island and Hantu Island, are a paradise for marine life.

The beach is peaceful and the seawater is clear, making it perfect for swimming, snorkeling, and diving. You can dive into the colorful coral reefs or try fishing. Despite its mysterious past, Hantu Island is a breathtaking natural beauty destination.

Sisters Island: Dive into Ocean Paradise

Walking south, you will stumble upon Singapore's island resort - sisters Island, where Singapore's first marine park is located. The Little sisters Island is dedicated to protecting turtle nests, while the Big sisters Island is a place for activities. You can rest on the beach, swim in the emerald green waters, or snorkel to enjoy underwater wonders.

If you are eager to learn, please visit the Ocean Park Public Gallery on St. John's Island. Please remember to respect nature - bring your own food and drinks without leaving any traces.
section: A very beautiful island, just a stone's throw away from the hustle and bustle. If you long to escape the hustle and bustle of the city and feel the breath of nature, why not take a ferry to see these hidden treasures?
